intro: Cirrhaea violascens, commonly known as the violetleaf cirrhaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, violet-colored leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
